Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup at junction of lip and bowl; interior glazed black; exterior: part of wide painted black band at top of handle zone; below, black-figure decoration consisting of head of cock with comb in faded added red, red on beak and added white on eye, to right.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0472) (Phase 1)
